text: hi there this is talia and in this demo
we're going to walk through how to
create the resources that we're going to
need to run an amazon h2i jupiter
notebook tutorial
that includes an amazon sagemaker
notebook instance an s3 bucket and a
private work team
so to get started let's head over to the
s3 console
and here we're going to create a bucket
in the region that we want to use for
the demo
so to do that i'm going to go to create
bucket you need to give your bucket a
unique
name
and once your bucket is created you can
head back over to
aws management console and go to
sagemaker
i'm going to leave s3 console open for
reference i'm going to go over to the
notebook insta
instances section of the sagemaker
console and if you don't have a notebook
and since created already
you can create a notebook instance here
you need to give this instance
a unique name
you can use mlt2 medium instance type
for this demo
if you don't have an execution role
already created you can use this drop
down menu to create a new role
you need to make sure that this role has
access to the s3 bucket that you just
created and that you're going to use for
the demo so you can
select any s3 bucket which will give
this execution role permission to use
any s3 bucket in your account
or you can select specific s3 buckets
and
put this bucket name into this field
and select great role and then that will
only have permission to use that bucket
and then here in github repositories you
can use this option
clone a public github repository to this
notebook instance only
to clone any public github repo directly
into your notebook instance and then all
of the files
and folders in that repo will be
accessible in your instance so
here we're going to clone the repo
amazon hoi sample
jupiter notebooks which contains the
demo that we're going to use today
i'm going to copy and paste the https
url right here into a github repository
url
and then select create notebook instance
and you can see that the instance is
pending
once the instance is in service you can
go ahead and select open jupyter lab
you'll see once it opens that the amazon
hti sample jupyter notebooks folder is
already
in your notebook instance because you
cloned that repo in here
and we're going to be using this ati
video transcription with
amazon transcribe example notebook
now to get started you can go ahead and
run the cells that set up the sdks and
other libraries we're going to be using
you can also specify that s3 bucket you
created
for bucket
and for roles and permissions you're
going to want to make sure that the
execution rule that you're using
to run your notebook instance has these
required permissions
this is the same role that's going to be
used to run your transcription job
and to create your human loops and so it
needs permission to access
amazon transcribe and amazon augmented
ai
apis and your s3 bucket that has your
input data and other resources
so to do that we can go
to the iam console
and i'm going to grab this unique
timestamp here
so i can use it to search under roles
for my execution role
i'm gonna select it to go to the summary
page so as you can see here i already
have these two policies attached if i
didn't have one attached for example
amazon transcribe i can go to attach
policies
search for the policy select
that policy and just select attach
policy and then now you'll see it's
attached
so the last thing you need to do to
configure your notebook so that you can
run it end to end is to create a warp
team
and you're going to specify your work
team down here under work team arn
so here i'm going to show you how to
create a work team
i'm going to go to the sagemaker console
and i'm going to go
under ground truth to labeling
workforces and then i'm going to go to
the private workforce tab and the reason
i'm under ground truth
rather than augmented ai is because
ground truth and augmented ai share the
same private workforce
here i don't have a private work team
created so i'm going to go ahead and
create one
i'm going to use aws cognito
i'm going to invite new workers by email
and i'm just going to put my email in
here
so that i can receive the human review
tasks that get created in the demo
and i can be the one who does then so i
can run the demo end to end
here i'm going to select create private
team and you'll see that a private
workforce gets created in your account
as well as the private team that you
just created
because i put myself as a worker i'm
also going to receive an email inviting
me to this private workforce
this is what that email looks like and i
can use this link
and this temporary password
to log in
and then i need to reset my password
and this new password i'm using is what
i'm going to use moving forward to log
into my worker portal
now note if you go back to the private
tab under ground truth
you'll see your labeling portal sign in
url is located here as well so you can
always reference that
if you need to get quick access to the
worker portal
so now you need to copy the work team
arn and paste it here in your notebook
under work team arn once you've done
that you're ready to run the notebook
and to end so let's do that next
